intro: Simbuleta brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved simbuleta, is a member of the Simbuletaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous plant characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in areas with humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
